Rubiks’s Cube Simulator Documentation¶

Rubik’s Cube Simulator is a Python application for simulating and manipulating a standard 3x3 Rubik’s Cube. This project provides a complete object-oriented implementation with support for face rotations, cube shuffling, state validation, and visual console display.

class rubiks_cube.Cube(faces: tuple[Face, Face, Face, Face, Face, Face])[source]¶

Represents a standard 3x3 Rubik’s Cube composed of six faces.

Each face is represented by a Face object with an associated center color. Cube methods allow rotating faces, shuffling, checking solved state, and displaying the cube in the console.

display_all_faces() → None[source]¶

Print an unfolded representation of the cube to the console.

  • White face on top

  • Four side faces in the middle row (O, G, R, B)

  • Yellow face on bottom

Each cell is drawn via its draw_square() method.

get_face_by_key(key: str) → Face[source]¶

Retrieve a Face object by its single-character key.

Parameters:

key – One of ‘r’, ‘o’, ‘g’, ‘b’, ‘w’, ‘y’.

Returns:

The corresponding Face instance.

is_solved() → bool[source]¶

Check if the cube is in a solved state.

Returns:

True if all six faces are uniform in color, False otherwise.

rotate_face(rotated_face: Face, clockwise: bool) → None[source]¶

Rotate a single face and update its neighbors accordingly.

Parameters:

  • rotated_face – The Face to rotate.

  • clockwise – True for clockwise, False for counter-clockwise.

shuffle(target_count: int = 35, max_count: int = 100) → None[source]¶

Perform a random sequence of face rotations to shuffle the cube.

Parameters:

  • target_count – Desired number of random moves (default 35).

  • max_count – Hard limit on moves to avoid infinite loops (default 100).

The method avoids immediate inverse moves on the same face.

class rubiks_cube.CubeController[source]¶

Manages creation and manipulation of Cube objects through high-level operations.

This includes generating a solved cube, loading cube state from JSON files, and parsing user key commands into cube face rotations.

static convert_keys(cube_obj: Cube, keys: tuple[str, str, str]) → tuple[Face, bool][source]¶

Parse a triple of user keys into a face rotation command.

Parameters:

  • cube_obj – Cube on which to perform the rotation.

  • keys – Tuple of three strings: (observed_face, neighbor_face, clockwise_flag). Face keys: ‘r’,’o’,’g’,’b’,’w’,’y’. Clockwise flag: ‘y’ for clockwise.

Returns:

  • The Face object to rotate.

  • A boolean indicating rotation direction (True=clockwise).

Return type:

A tuple containing

Raises:

ValidatorError – If keys are invalid or not recognized.

classmethod create_cube_from_file(file_name: str, file_dir: str = None) → Cube[source]¶

Load cube face colors from a JSON file and construct a Cube.

Parameters:

  • file_name – Name of the JSON file containing cube face data.

  • file_dir – Directory path where file is located. Defaults to data_dir.

The JSON file must have a top-level “faces” object mapping face keys to 3x3 lists of color keys (“r”,”o”,”g”,”b”,”w”,”y”).

Returns:

A Cube instance with faces colored according to the file.

Raises:

ValidatorError – If the file path or data format is invalid.

red, orange, green, blue, white, yellow.

class rubiks_cube.FaceColors(value, names=<not given>, *values, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)[source]¶

Enumeration of standard Rubik’s Cube face colors with ANSI 256-color codes.

Members:

RED: ANSI code “196” for red background. ORANGE: ANSI code “208” for orange background. GREEN: ANSI code “46” for green background. BLUE: ANSI code “21” for blue background. YELLOW: ANSI code “226” for yellow background. WHITE: ANSI code “15” for white background.

draw_square() → None[source]¶

Render a single colored square in the terminal using ANSI escape codes.

This prints a space character with the background color set to the enum’s ANSI code and resets formatting afterward.
